Geometry Dash is a challenging, one-button, colorful, techno rave that made me more emotional than many relationships.

Part of the allure of Geometry Dash is its simple controls; more precisely control. One button performs an action such as a jump, flip, or other momentum change. The game is either having the button down or not down, and performing this task correctly takes you to the end of the level where you can celebrate your victory as you see fit. Me I like a simple smile and approving nod, but I'm a class act that prefers to hide his emotions in the name of stoic professionalism, even in my moments alone.

This game is a grown up version of The Impossible Game who filled out quite nicely and gets much deserved attention. The look of the game can change substantially from level to level, particularly for the user submitted content, as can the music, but it is often colorful, minimalist, and very stimulating. There's a lot of great music tracks, and the game levels often use those tracks to determine when buttons are pressed yielding a feeling not unlike dancing, but on one button, which yields a pure sensation of rhythm.

There is a practice mode which is the preferred method for learning a level as death does not send you back to the beginning, and you can practice many areas repeatedly, although the real game is finishing real mode where you do the whole level in one shot.

Achievements in this game are linked directly to customization options for your beautiful little shape man. Coins are collected in level and linked to achievements, and the unlocking of additional levels. They are a challenge though, requiring rerouting through a level to pick up. Once collected the stage must be finished, so it seemed prudent to leave these until a level was well learned, unless you learned the level in the way through picking them up.

reviewText: What can I say about Geometry Dash? First of all, for all of you wondering what kind of game is this, let's just say it's a The Impossible Game clone. Now, it might be a clone, but it's a damn good one. Gameplay is a lot more varied, there's a whole bunch of levels, great music, level editor and online level sharing(now with the ability to put custom music in your levels from Newgrounds!) , lots of unlockables and lots of dying. Yea, even though the controls are as simple as they can get, this isn't an easy game by any means, but if you are ready to accept the challenge, you're gonna enjoy this game a lot. The devs are amazing and they make constant free updates and keep adding new stuff into this alerady amazing game. I kind of wish they had added Steam leaderboards into this version, even though the game does have its own leaderboards for those who make Robtop account. Btw, currently there are some performance issues when playing the game in windowed mode, but besides that, this is a good port. All in all, I will give this game a 9/10, a must have have for all the fans of hardcore games.

Geometry Dash is one of those arcade styled classics that you just have to play for hours on end. This game is something you wouldn't think you would spend hours on. reviewText: Geometry Dash is a very fun, frusterating platformer.\n\nYou have to jump through a series of obstacles that sometimes defy gravity. You can be a rocket ship, or UFO, just to name a few. There's a bunch of default levels, that go from easy to demon. Each level gets harder. First time playing it you may have a hard time, but the more you play it, the better you will get. Easy levels are, well, easy.  Then comes Normal, a bit harder then Easy. After that is Hard, which is quite hard. Then, there is Very Hard, which is very challenging. After that is Insane which is extremely hard, then Demon, the hardest. There's a bunch of community-made levels, so you can basically never get bored. It's a great game, all in all, and I totally recommend it.  It also goes VERY cheap on sales, so you can pick it up for 1.99 sometimes. 10/10. Amazing game.

reviewText: I was young and naive, I didn't know any better. I had a full life ahead of me, aspirations and dreams maybe even someone special someday. It was like any other day, waking up and getting ready to venture into the world. I could hear the birds chirping and the car not starting. I sat in the driver seat waiting to start the car up again. As I tried once more this time slightly pressing the gas pedal the car began with an unpleasant sound, but it started so I was content. The day progressed and I took some time to eat my lunch as I had an hour break between my next classes. I sat and opened up my laptop like everyother day. I watched some shows and browsed some steam games which I had been doing every other day. Today was different a game caught my eye, it appeared to be a simple concept for a game. Using only one key to move a cube up to dodge spikes, walls and other obstacles. I contemplated on buying it at first due to how simple it had appeared, but I overlooked this after seeing an overwhelming amount of people who liked the game. Even still though I hesitated before buying the game unsure why, almost as if I my subconscious was telling me something. I proceeded in buying the game but did not play it yet. I still had a few hours left before I would play this game for the first time. On the drive home I decided to tilt the car seat back for the first time, I'm not sure what made me decide to do this as I had been driving home for over 3 years but none the less I had decided to. I also have been listening to some classical music that plays on the radio. Beyond relaxed on the way home, I was unaware of what unfortunate fate would soon become of me. I pulled into my garage and parked the car, as I got out I grabbed my bag and headed inside the house. I knelt down and untied my boots and the was greeted by my dog. I let her outside and started to set up my laptop to play the game. As I loaded the game I heard a scratch at the door and let my dog inside. That was the last thing I remember of my life before this game. I started to play and was easily lured in by the friendly colours and the customizations. I started the first level and died , I then began attempt 2  ofthe level only to die once again. It was fun, frustrating and addicting, but after completing the first level I felt some satisfaction. It didn't stop there though, I needed to fully complete the level which would take more attempts replaying it  over and over until I could truly be free from the level. I have been seeing boxes and spikes and visions of the game since I have closed it. My thoughts are no longer my own I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to think without flashes of this game again. I have only one option now, attempt to play through the entire game and hope completing it will bring back what it has taken from me.

reviewText:
On its surface, Geometry dash looks like a shameless impossible game ripoff, however, with a level builder able to construct  very hard levels, as well as easy ones, with an integrated ability to share your level.
There are also more mechanics than one would find in the impossible game, such as parts where you fly around in a kind of jet, or one where you basically play flappy bird but fun.
There are also hidden collectibles (coins), and after collecting 20, and 30 coins you will unlock new, insanely hard levels.
Additionally, assuming the PC version will go the same way as the mobile version, there will be regular updates, bringing new levels.
Finally, there is a practice mode incase you are messing up on one part of the level or can't find a coin on a level.
This review isn't to say that it's a perfect game, because quite simply it's not. A lot of people won't like it simply because of its genre, and admittedly, as a mobile port it does have some major UI issues (it's probably what keeps this from going onto my favourites list, hopefully the developer fixes up the PC version and gets some proper UI).
Overall, however, this is an extremely enjoyable game brought down by its UI problems, and not everyone will enjoy this genre.
TL;DR:
Pros:
- Fun game, rewarding and challenging.
- Level editor with built in sharing.
- Plenty of levels, with updates bringing more.
- Collectibles, which unlock new, hard levels.
- Practice mode.

Cons:
- Major UI issues - may bring the game too low to buy outside of a sale.
- Semi-niche genre, you may hate the game because of it.
~7-8/10

reviewText:
If you are looking for a cheap challenging game with GREAT soundtracks but easy to get into then you have come at the right place.

Pros:
- Awesome original soundtracks, make you dance everytime.
- Smooth gameplay.
- Beautiful graphics.
- Practice mode where you have checkpoints.
- Low System Requirements, probably can run on any crappy PC.
- Getting harder and harder with many new mechanics (Ships, Ball, Wave, UFO, ect.).
- Version 2.0 is really close when I write this review, it means more new mechanics.
- Level Editor means you can play online levels or creates your own levels!
- The community is awesome.
- Steam version is the best, remember the time when I use Bluestacks to play the game ... omg it lags as hell. Also Steam version has 2 unlockable icons!
- Many Steam Achievements and also Trading Cards.

Inbetweens:
- The rage.
- Auto-checkpoints in practice mode can sometimes be annoying. (you can disable auto-checkpoints anyway)

Cons:
- No keys configuration yet. You can only use Left Click, Spacebar and Up arrow atm.
- The tutorial for new mechanics is pretty vague, but it is easy anyway so don't worry.
- Triple spikes
- Time Machine is a thing here

Conclusion: Geometry Dash is just awesome. Give it a try!
Rating: 10/10.

Then, as you start getting further in the game, the levels start becoming a little more unforgiving and you have to maneuver through even more obstacles that come your way. reviewText:
-  jman4540 [twitch.tv]
This game will keep you trying and trying... But that one good feeling when you finally complete a level you practiced is the best feeling you will get. Or even making a level and getting stars or a feature on it. You don't have to have good reflexes to play the game, you can build levels! If you aren't that good of a builder and you have amazing reflexes, beat the levels! Or both!

Vehicles:
Cube: Tap to jump. Simple enough. (Infinite space on screen)
Ship: Tap/Hold to go up. Do nothing to go down. (Can fly straight if repeatedly tapping) (10 Block space of room on screen)
Ball: Switch gravity on tap. (Rings/Orbs do not apply unless Green or Blue) (8 Block space of room on screen)
UFO: Tap to jump, can repeatedly jump in midair. (10 Block space of room on screen)
Wave: Hit anything with a hitbox, dead. Tap to go up in a diagonal direction. Do nothing to go down. (10 Block space of room on screen)
[NEW] Robot: Tap to jump. Hold to jump higher. (Infinite space on screen)

Mini: Affects all vehicles to make them smaller.
Gravity Portals: Can make the player go upside-down or right-side up. (Mini-Upsidedown wave is the bane of my existence)

Slow Speed: Slower than normal.
Normal Speed: Just normal.
Double Speed: Twice as fast.
Triple Speed: 3 times as fast.

LOL = Lots of Lenny ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Anyway.
10/10. One of the best games I have ever played ;3

reviewText:
Overview:
Geometry Dash is to The Impossible Game like Terraria is to Minecraft. Although people first playing it might call it a rubbish clone, if they play for more than 20 minutes, they will realise the game is far from a clone, and in the case of Geometry Dash at least, much better. The concept is exactly the same as The Impossible Game. You’re a cube, moving forwards and jumping over spikes and blocks making your way to the end of the level. However, Geometry Dash has way more customization, depth and intriguing mechanics. As of the 2.0 update, you can take control of a soaring ship, jumpy UFO, gravity-changing ball, trigonometrical wave, and a booster-jumping robot. There are 20 playable levels each with heart-pounding and bass-pumping atmospheric songs that fit perfectly with them. What’s more, new content and levels are added every few months to keep the experience fresh, alongside the infinite replayability of the level editor with a search function, and with dedicated and talented creators having their levels featured for everyone to easily see.


Positive

- Deliciously difficult and infuriating, meaning a huge sense of achievement upon completion
- 20 levels taking about 30-40 hours of in-level time to finish every one
- Dedicated level editor allowing you to create any level that the creators could with searching and featured levels
-Tons of customisation
- Tons of wacky and fun vehicles and mechanics that change how you play

Negative

-Can get very tiring, and some of the levels need updating
-Not so easy for newcomers to the genre

Overall

Gameplay : 9/10
Graphics : 7/10
Replayability : 9/10

VERDICT : 8/10

reviewText:
Geometry Dash is a difficult fast-paced rythm-platformer, where you have to guide a geometric figure trough many challenging levels filled with lots of different obstacles. This game reminds me of the original ''The Impossible Game'' but Geometry Dash is way more complex.

The gameplay is simple and straightforward. It consists of a square moving trough the level and you have to press space to jump. It sounds easy, but it really isn't, on your way you will encounter many obstacles such as spikes, gaps, saws, thorns, pads used to jump higher or even change the direction of gravity and portals. To pass these you will have to perfectly time every of your jumps. You will die if you touch any hazard and this will restart the level from the beginning. You can choose to play on practice mode, where checkpoints will be avalable instead of restarting the level from the beginning if dead. This game offers a great mix between easy levels and hard levels, but even easy levels will require skill and memorizing the level. The game is very addicting, you will want to continue on playing even though you keep on losing. The gameplay is very smooth and the controls are very responsive. Each time you complete a level you will be rewarded with stars which are used to unlock new things and there are secret coins hidden around the levels which require you to take alternate, harder and riskier paths to collect and also the level design is great. Every time you unlock an achievement, you will unlock a new geometry figure or a new colour as well. There are a lot of shapes and colours to unlock and customize your character as you like. If you completed the default levels, you can also play levels created by other players on the level editor. You can like, dislike, rate their difficulty and even comment on those levels. You can create and share your own levels on the level editor, and Steam users get two exclusive unlockable icons. If you played this game before on mobile, you can link your mobile version and unlock all achievements, colours and shapes for PC. The game gets constantly updated and the community is very nice and friendly.

The graphics look amazing, vibrant colours and beautiful visual effects with a simple, minimalistic design. The soundtrack is simply great, there are many songs which are very energetic and fast-paced just like the game.

I recommend this game, fun addicting and simple with beautiful minimalistic graphics, 9/10.

IN SUMMERY

Platform Timed" jump puzzle game
Hone your jump skill as you jump and die to the catchy soundtrack over and over and OVER. :)
It is sort of in the same vein as twitch music rhythm or bullet-hell shooters but in the form of a jump game.

PRO
The pull is wanting to master the levels (surviving the levels) and steadily seeing yourself improve as you die horribly over and over to the catchy music! When you get good enough and the game hits its stride you get that uphoric feeling of being "in the zone" similar to mastering an Expert Guitar Hero song you tearing through flawlessly or beating a butllet-hell shooter boss without getting hit.

The road is long and hard but when you get there it is glorious! It tends to have that little extra something that makes you want to try "just one more time" again and again. It also has a practice mode so you can practice the levels with infinate lives.

Did I mention the music is catchy? Wonderful music. I want the sound track!

CON
This game isn't for the faint of heart

reviewText:
Review: Geometry Dash By: RobTopGames

Who would have thought of it? A side-scrolling platformer/rage game in which you play as a shape-shifting cube who must navigate through dangerous terrain in order to beat the level. It's genius! The developer is constantly working on new game modes to extend the already-extremely wide variety to gameplay and level design. The level editor is a very nice and convenient way of keeping players gripped to the game even after completing all 20 levels, while forming a community of great creations and amazing friends.

Here's a few things I've enjoyed about this game:
The possibilities are endless! With the level editor you can create pretty much ANYTHING you like, with billions of possible design combinations.
The variety of gameplay is amazing and there are still plenty of different and unique game-modes to come.
The Leaderboard System is a great way to promote the incredible skill of some of the best players/creators.
The ability to change your icons, ships etc. makes every player uniq5e in a special way
So many features for such a LOW price!.
Personally, I think that this is one of the best games that you can get for the £2.79 it's worth. It shows that even at a low price, you can still get a fairly large amount of features. I've really enjoyed this game so far, and once you get it too, you'll see that it's really worth the £3/$4 you paid for it.

Score:10/10
Amazing game. Would recommend it to friends and family.

-fabman650
